Summary Heading: Nice room, but annoying rip-off charges
Summary: Stayed one night for business.  Service was solid at check-in and check-out.  Lobby and atrium looked chic, with nice furnishings and good style.  The rooms were on the smaller side, but extraordinarily well-designed; the furniture fit the space well and there was nice room to relax and work.  Bed was comfortable.  Closet, bathroom, etc. all well-designed and functional.  Location nothing special in-terms of immediate surroundings, but is within 5 minutes of the airport, and it’s an easy drive to several restaurants, South Coast Plaza shopping, etc.  Two turn-offs.  The first was the parking charge; the hotel’s lot is huge, and it was nearly empty during my stay.  It’s a surface lot, not covered or secured, etc.  Charging for parking in this situation just seems like a rip-off.
Manager Response: brmusicman,  Thank you for leaving us a detailed review. We do apologize if the parking fee and cost of coffee caused any inconvenience. We will be sure to share your comments with our upper management as they proceed to further improve our day to day operations. We are glad you enjoyed the nice furnishings and style and happy to hear the bed was comfortable. We thank you for sharing your feedback and insights and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again the next time you are visiting Newport Beach.  Kind Regards, Anisa

Summary: I’ve stayed here several times for work training and they always have exceptional customer service and amenities. Pick up from airport and transportation to the training center as well as on site food and drink.
Manager Response: Hello apearse16,  We are glad you enjoyed the amenities and happy to hear the customer service met expectations. We thank you for sharing your insights and feedback and hope to welcome you again soon!  Best, Anisa

We knew that the crowds of Labor Day weekend would be a lot so this was a nice way to spend it. It's far enough from L.A. to feel like a getaway without the expected crowds that were a little further south. It's centrally located, clean and has a great staff. I want to thank Myjelle and Janica for reaffirming the standard set from our last visit by Andrew. Everyone was nice and met or exceeded our expectations. The meals that we had at Wave were delicious and the presentation as well.   It was nice to receive the welcome note and we genuinely appreciated the effort of Myjelle and Janica to ensure we had the best room available.
Manager Response: Greetings L D,       Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel; we appreciate that. I loved the fast

Great bathroom, awesome beds, and huge TV's with built-in Chromecast...so good :)    And carpet !!   I used to love Marriot until they got rid of all their carpet.   The vinyl plank in all their hotels is cold, loud, and echo-y.  I hate it.   I laugh at all the reviewers that comment on the Marriott "hardwood floors".   LOL!  It's NOT hardwood.  It's vinyl plank.  Its PLASTIC.

Adults that were supposedly chaperoning children were passing around bottles of Jack Daniels and yelling "shots, shots, shots" well into the late evening.  I expect better from Hyatt.  I paid to stay at a four star hotel, not a bar.  My advice, shop around.  Hyatt is not the only game in town.

Summary Heading: Globalists BEWARE - free night stays with points do NOT get free parking
Summary: I booked a Guest of Honor booking for my parents March 17 to 20. That means when a Globalist books a hotel stay with points, all Benefits of the Globalist are supposed to transfer to the guest. Well, my dad called me to let me know that he got charged for parking ($25 per night). I called and spoke to two Globalist line staff who both reported this particular property is playing games - free night stays with points do NOT get free parking. There is nothing on the Hyatt hotel page to suggest this, but had I known this, I would have booked a different hotel for my parents. So Globalists, BEWARE. It's a shame because my parents really enjoyed the hotel room and front desk staff.
